title.rendered: Vaughan Handyman: What to Consider When Choosing Basement Paint Colours

content.rendered:
Paint colours can make a space; they can make it feel a certain way, happy or comfortable. People spend a lot of time choosing colours for their living spaces, but many often ignore the basement area of the house. Still, the basement can be such a wonderful space if given the attention it deserves from house painting services in Vaughan.

A professional service can help homeowners assess the unpainted or unfinished space and determine the correct shade or pattern. A painting service can take a bland room and make it come to life, become inviting, and set a vibe. Painting is a way of awakening and invigorating an otherwise dull, dark, and cold room. Discover how to paint a basement to get the results you want.

Tips for Painting a Basement

First, interior house painting is different than exterior painting. You use different materials and tools. Despite the similarities between a basement and exterior surfaces, primarily exposed walls, it is an interior painting project. If you do not have a finished basement, you may want to use exterior paints to combat problems like moisture and mould. If using exterior paints, you should let the area remain unoccupied for a couple of weeks to reduce any issues with VOCs.

Besides choosing between exterior or interior paint, which a professional can help, homeowners must decide how to enliven the space best. Basements are naturally dark and dreary. Some lower levels have egress windows that help brighten the area with natural light, but most only have small hopper-style windows or glass blocks. Creating a brighter, more welcoming atmosphere is possible with three tips.

1. Start With a Plan

Every painting project requires planning. You need to figure out the amount of paint you need, what tools are necessary, and a timeline for the project.

If you are painting over raw concrete or cinderblock, you must prime the surface to reduce the amount of paint you use. You should use a primer for every painting project because it helps the paint layer go down smoothly with better colour application.

Depending on the project and the desired finish, you may need paint brushes or rollers. Rollers usually provide a smoother look than paint brushes, but if you’re laying down multiple coats, paint brushes are an excellent option, especially for cut-in work.

Finally, setting a timeline helps you plan your days. Basements are large areas and may take more time than you expect. If you are working with professional painting services, you can rest assured the project will be finished quickly and effectively.

2. Lighten Things Up

Basements are naturally dark, so the last thing you want is to select a dark colour for the finish. While darker accents may work well, the primary colour palette should be light and airy to make the space appear larger and less cave-like. Some fitting colour choices include:

    • Beige
    • Light gray
    • White
    • Pastel yellow
    • Sky blue

3. Use Appropriate Lighting and Furniture

A space’s feeling is more than colour selection; it is also about lighting and furniture. Many basements do not have a lot of lighting, especially in older homes, because the room was never intended for living in. A handyman in Vaughan, licensed in electrical work, can help lay out more lighting. Lighting will also affect how paint colours look on the walls.

Furniture selection is also important. While basements are often large spaces, they also lack headroom. Choosing big, bulky, dark furniture can easily overwhelm the space. Smaller pieces or sleeker designs are usually best for basements.

Handyman Connection: House Painting Services You Can Trust

Are you ready to change your basement for the better? Contact Handyman Connection and learn more about our professional painting services. Schedule an appointment with a professional painter and learn how selecting the right colours for your basement can significantly affect how the space feels.
